result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Jeremy E Reichhoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.notes: *Comply with conditions in the DPA filed.

supervisions.notes: Payment Plan:  $50/month, commencing in June plus $15 PPF

*Granted Huber.  *Sentence to commence forthwith.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

Defendant Jeremy E Reichhoff in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant did try to get an Attorney but could not get one.  

BY THE COURT: Court will reset one more time
bond continued  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2018 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on January 4, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy E Reichhoff in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that his office received a letter from Atty Newton stating that he did not represent the defendant.  Court did receive the letter.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant does not have an Attorney for this matter; he did try but his Attorney would not come this far to represent him.  Defendant wants to go forward without an Attorney.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant wants to get an Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Reset to give the defendant time to get an Attorney.
bond continued  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2018 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Court from Atty Newton
Sentencing hearing on December 7, 2017 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Jeremy E Reichhoff in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is a motion to terminate the DPA.  Court questions the defendant regarding counsel.  Defendant states that he has an Attorney from Madison on a different matter and is not sure if he would come here.  Court advises defendant of his options for counsel.
Defendant wants to proceed without counsel.    Court finds waiver of attorney made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.

Atty Hendee states the basis of the motion.  Defendant states that he has not been convicted nor did he plea in that Columbia County case.

BY THE COURT:  Court grants the State's motion to terminate the DPA; court finds the defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee is prepared to proceed.  Court questions the defendant regarding counsel.  Defendant wants counsel.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Sentencing
bond continued  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2017 at 11:15 am.
from Greg Reichhoff
Motion hearing on November 1, 2017 at 11:35 am.
in Support to Motion to Terminate DPA
to Terminate DPA

*No contact with victim.
4/7/16:  the no unsupervised contact with any female under the age of 18 is ordered removed.

Defendant Jeremy E Reichhoff in court with attorney John Andrew Newton.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that the matter is resolved and the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.    Atty Hendee is amending the information with amending Ct. 1 to 940.225(3m) and adding a Ct. 2 947.01(1) and states agreement.    Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 18 months Probation on Ct. 1.   Atty Hendee files the amended information with the court.  Atty Newton states that the matter is not a felony now so he was not prepared to waive a prelim.  Atty Hendee moves to amend the complaint and not the information due to this not being a felony now.  Court agrees with that.
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea to the amended complaint.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the added Ct. 2, 947.01(1) and approves the 18 month DPA on the amended Ct. 1, 940.225(3m).

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Newton  makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1, 940.225(3m):  Court approves and signs the 18 month DPA with conditions.

Ct. 2, 947.01(1):  Court orders 20 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report forthwith
Court Costs = $243.00
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in June

Defendant Jeremy E Reichhoff in court with attorney John Andrew Newton.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Atty Newton states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
Atty Newton has no objection.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $5,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today
*No contact with the victim
*No unsupervised contact with any female under the age of 18 except for his sister

Atty Newton states that the defendant will waive time limits and asks for a return.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.  Set for return.  Return date scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
